meanings.definition: Present and explain (a theory or idea) systematically and in detail.
meanings.sent1: She expounds on the importance of recycling in a clear and organized manner.
meanings.sent2: The teacher expounds the lesson on photosynthesis to the students.
meanings.sent3: He expounds on the benefits of eating vegetables with such enthusiasm that it's contagious.
meanings.sent4: The author expounds on the complexities of human nature in his latest novel.
meanings.sent5: The scientist expounds on the mysteries of the universe, captivating his audience.

meanings.definition: Explain the meaning of (a text or speech).
meanings.sent1: The librarian expounds the moral of the story to the children after reading them a fable.
meanings.sent2: During the lecture, the professor expounds the significance of the historical document.
meanings.sent3: The comedian expounds the punchline of the joke, leaving the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The detective expounds the cryptic message found at the crime scene.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide expounds the history of the ancient ruins, bringing the past to life for visitors.
